intro: Andryala christii, commonly known as the Christ's andryala, is a rare flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered in many areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
